cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the construction of linear codes for distributed data storage systems, which is a topic that falls under the information theory (cs.IT) and distributed systems (cs.DS) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the structure and properties of these codes, which could fall under the data structures (cs.DS) and algorithms (cs.DC) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes deterministic constructions for these codes, which could fall under the coding theory (cs.CC) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the potential computational complexity of the proposed constructions, which could fall under the computational complexity (cs.CC) and systems and control (cs.SI) sub-categories.
